column16: Windsor Castle from the Thames with figures in the foreground
column41: Materials: watercolor and gouache on laid paper Measurements: 20.47 in. (52.00 cm.) (height) by 29.92 in. (76.00 cm.) (width) Markings: signed and dated 'P Sandby 1802' (lower right) Exhibited: By the 1760s Paul was regularly painting views of Windsor Castle and its environs, and in the 1770s he and Thomas published their famous series of aquatints of the Terrace at Windsor. The subject of the castle, with its origins in the 11th century with William the Conqueror, clearly attracted Paul who travelled throughout England and Wales recording the architectural heritage of the land. His work appealed to antiquarians and Joseph Banks (1743-1820) owned over 70 of his Windsor views. In 1769 Paul Sandby became a founder member of the Royal Academy, and views of Windsor featured among his most popular  works over the years. (One wag writing in the London Evening Post of the watercolors Sandby  at the RA in 1775 quipped 'the best views of Windsor are to be taken from Pall Mall')

column16: A beauty and her attendants on a terrace at dusk
column41: Materials: Opaque pigments and gold on paper Measurements: 10.04 in. (25.50 cm.) (height) by 6.77 in. (17.20 cm.) (width) Size Notes: painting; folio: 30.4 x 22 cm Description: The noble lady in a red and gold angharka and odhni standing on a terrace receiving tikka placing it on her forehead, the attendant in a burgundy dupatta holding a tray and mirror, two maidservants in the foreground with a sculpture of Gajalakshmi, a palace behind them and three attendants on the parapet above, with floral borders, gold border between black rules, applied printed gold and blue floral margins Markings: the reverse with devanagri inscription, ownership stamps and librarian's signature Provenance: Royal Collection of Bikaner (no. 253), before 10 June 1964

Materials: Opaque pigments and gold on paper Measurements: 7.09 in. (18.00 cm.) (height) by 4.53 in. (11.50 cm.) (width) Size Notes: painting Description: Two elaborately bedecked ladies standing on a floral carpet, the lady at right clad in a lengha with gold waistband over a printed blue choli, glancing at her companion who turns profile to meet her gaze, the companion in a rose lengha and dupatta with green choli, each holding a betel case, within an interior painted with blue-and-white ceramics, trimmed on three sides, the upper edge with partial margin Markings: the reverse with devanagri inscription, ownership stamps and librarian's signature Provenance: Royal Collection of Bikaner (no. 5337), before 20 August 1964

column16: Sultan Muhammad 'Adil Shah of Bijapur with his Minister Ikhlas Khan
column41: Materials: Opaque pigments and gold on paper Measurements: 4.33 in. (11.00 cm.) (height) by 3.15 in. (8.00 cm.) (width) Size Notes: folio Description: India, Bikaner, after a Bijapuri original, Sultan Muhammad kneeling on a carpet against a red bolster wearing red pyjama and diaphanous white angharka, holding a betel case and a single rolled leaf, he wears a golden turban surmounted by a sarpech, Ilkhas Khan wearing yellow pyjama, mint-green angharka and purple sash, full red margin with white rules, yellow outer border Markings: the reverse with devanagri inscriptions, ownership stamp and librarian's signature Provenance: Royal Collection of Bikaner (no. 3624), before 19 August 1964

Materials: Opaque pigments and gold on paper Measurements: 5.51 in. (14.00 cm.) (height) by 3.39 in. (8.60 cm.) column16: Sketch for Kalyx Krater Trash Cans
column26: Cutting Edge: Pop & Contemporary Art for Beginning Collectors (Sale 407)
column41:
Materials: Graphite on paper Measurements: 24.02 in. (61.00 cm.) (height) by 16.73 in. (42.50 cm.) (width) Size Notes: irreg.; Frame: 67.9 x 50.2 cm Markings: Signed, titled and dated in pencil aSketch for Kalyx Krater Trash Cans James Rosenquist 1975a Condition: Framed, Good condition Provenance: /strong>

Gift from the artist to the present owner.

This study for the artistas famed aCalyx Krater Trash Cana series was created after Rosenquist learned of some deaccessions the Metropolitan Museum made from their permanent collection in order to purchase an ancient Greek vase by Eurphronios, called the Calyx Crater, for one million dollars. aThe ridiculousness of the idea of selling a Modigliani and a Soutine weighed on my mind, and while I was brooding about it, my friend Ronnie Westerfield took some peyote and had a dream about Greek drawings on a garbage can. I thought, I know what Iam going to do, Iam going to make miniature Calyx Kraters as garbage cans and make them out ofsolid gold.a (James Rosenquist quoted in aPainting Below Zero: Notes on a Life in Art,a New York, 2009, p.245-6).

James Rosenquist (American, b. 1933)

Arguably the most openly political artist associated with the Pop Art movement, James Rosenquist studied at the University of Minnesota under Cameron Booth. He painted his first billboard in 1954, and a year later was awarded a scholarship to attend the Art Students League in New York. After completing his studies, he began a career as a commercial billboard painter, laying the foundations for his later large-scale compositions. His fragmented imagery drew from many commercial, social and political sources; During the Vietnam War, Rosenquist became more openly critical of the military-industrial complex and American consumerism. In 2003, the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum mounted a major retrospective of his works, which traveled to the Menil Collection, Museum of Fine Arts in Houston, and Guggenheim Museum Bilbao. Rosenquist lives and works in Aripeka, Florida.

Condition

In generally good condition with pale scattered foxing and minor soft handling crease in the upper left margin.

Institut Valencia daArt Modern.

Fraught with dreamlike intensity, this work by American painter Inka Essenhigh creates a surreal sensibility within its environment. A figurative form with a snake-like body and human face is wrapped around the peak of a mountain with a broken top. A smaller figure with a skull-like face, perhaps representing death, pulls the larger figure down as it grasps on for its life.

Ink Essenhigh (American, b. 1969)

With a distinctively graphic style of painting, Inka Essenhighas works draw on an awareness of contemporary culture and her immediate environment. Born in Pennsylvania, Essenhigh studied at the School of Visual Arts, New York. Infused with dreamlike and surreal imagery, her work is in the collections of major museums including Albright-Knox Art Gallery, Buffalo, NY; Denver Art Museum; Museum of Contemporary Art, North Miami; Museum of Modern Art / P.S.1 Center for Contemporary Art, New York; San Francisco Museum of Modern Art; Seattle Art Museum; Tate, London; Virginia Museum of Fine Art, Richmond and Whitney Museum of American Art, New York.

Lehmann Maupin, New York.

With Surrealist imagery, this watercolor by American artist Bryan Crockett creates a dynamic dream-like narrative. The left of the composition depicts a man with his head ingrown into the tree; Crockett created a sculpture of this same imagery. With the same title, the 10-foot tree on a rock contained a self-portrait of the artist with his head grown into the structure. This work was the central sculpture at Lehmann Maupinas 2005 exhibition, aDrawn Out of My Mind.a

Bryan Crockett (American, b. 1970)

Born in California, Bryan Crockett studied at Yale University. His work has been included in numerous exhibitions, including shows at Tate Liverpool and the Brooklyn Museum. Crockett has also exhibited at Kunsthalle Basel, Exit Art, Fotouhi Cramer Gallery, and the 1997 Whitney Biennial. In that same year he was the recipient of the Louis Comfort Tiffany Foundation Award. The artist currently lives and works in Brooklyn, New York.

1 in. loss left margin. Otherwise good condition.

Byron Gallery, Inc., New York.

Hans Richter (German, 1888-1976)

Born Johannes Siegfried, Hans Richter studied at the Academy of Art in Berlin and Weimar, and the Academie Julian in Paris. By 1913, Richter had joined the avant-garde expressionist circles, and became a member of Die Aktion in 1914. Shortly thereafter, he was introduced to member of the Dada group, of which Richter would become closely associated. A member of the Association of Revolutionary Artists, Richter was forced to leave Germany, eventually emigrating to the United States where he directed numerous artistic films.

White Cube, London.

Neal Tait (British, b. 1965)

Born in Edinburgh, Neal Tait studied at Londonas Chelsea School of Art and the Royal College of Art. Exploring the tensions between opposites a the figurative and the abstract, the logical and the absurd, the beautiful and the grotesque a Taitas works often incorporate found materials to push the limits of representation. In 2000, Tait was awarded the British School at Rome Fellowship. His first solo exhibition was held in 2006 at Museum Dhont-Dhaenens in Belgium, and has since been the subject of solo exhibitions at White Cube in London, Sies + HAke Galerie in DA14sseldorf, and Monica da Cardenas in Milan. The artist currently lives and works in London.

Galeria de la Ciudadela, Punta del Este.

Highly descriptive of Mussoas oeuvre, aPersonajessa is emotive and gestural. Taking into consideration the socio-political undercurrents of mid-century Latin America, Musso takes the image of a cubist figure, slightly abstracted, with a very expressive and dark palette.

Carlos Musso (Uruguayan, b. 1954)

Closely associated with neo-expressionism, Uruguayan artist Carlos Mussoas works explore the rebelliousness and non-conformist mentality of a generation born from civil unrest and political strife. His works have been exhibited in Uruguay and worldwide, including the 2001 Cuenca Biennale Exhibition in Ecuador. Mussoas works can be found in the American Art Museum, Maldonado, Uruguay; the J.M. Blanes Museum, Montevideo; and the Del Gaucho y la Moneda Museum, Montevideo.

Slight stretcher marks along lower edge, otherwise in good condition.

Andrea Meislin Gallery, New York.

Best known for her work that constructs a mediating space between words and images, Michal Heiman is interested in the intersection of viewing and interpreting. aWhatas on Your Mind? #5a incorporates Heimanas study of gender expression; Heiman captures a seemingly candid image of a woman sitting. In the series, the women display expressions of boredom, fear or anger. Below the image is written aWHATaS ON YOUR MIND?a creating a focus on the interior dialogue of the subject, as well as our relationship to her.

Michal Heiman (Israeli, b. 1954)

Interdisciplinary artist Michal Heimanas practice includes installation, painting, photography and video. Her work is based on extensive psychological and philosophical research, centering on the themes of art history, politics and gender. Heiman exhibited at Documenta X in 1997, and her work has been the subject of numerous international exhibitions. She was the recipient of the first Shpilman International Prize for Excellence in Photography, which was accompanied by a solo exhibition at the Israel Museum in 2012. The artist currently lives and works in Tel Aviv, Israel.

Condition

Appears in overall good condition, unexamined out of frame.

Shipping costs excl. statutory VAT and plus 2,5% (+VAT) shipping insurance.

Goff + Rosenthal, New York

Influenced by Edward Hopper and Walker Evans, American Realist artist Scott Hunt depicts allegorical narratives found in discarded photographs. By combining the most intriguing elements of various snapshots, Hunt reveals a dark humor within American culture. aFancypantsa portrays a man sitting on a porch with his dog, pointing a shotgun at a man in a tie who sits on the steps before him. The setting sun creates a sharp contrast of shadows, heightened by the artistas use of charcoal.

Scott Hunt (American, b. 1958)

Working in the tradition of American Realism, American artist Scott Hunt is best known for this charcoal and pastel drawings of humorous narratives based on discarded snapshots found online and in flea markets. Huntas work has been the subject of six solo exhibitions and numerous group exhibitions worldwide. As an illustrator, his work has appeared in The New York Times, The New Yorker, The Boston Globe, and GQ Magazine. He is the recipient of a fellowship from The New York Foundation for the Arts, as well as a grant from the Pollock-Krasner Foundation. Two of Huntas drawings are in the permanent collection of The Israel Museum, Jerusalem.

Condition

In overall good condition, not examined out of frame.

Shipping costs excl. statutory VAT and plus 2,5% (+VAT) shipping insurance.

Materials: porcelain, polychromed and gilt Measurements: 7.09 in. (18.00 cm.) (height) Description: at the centre a girl holding flowers, next to her by a boy holding a sheep, the facing side with a sleeping girl watched over by her dog, next to her a seated boy sheering his sheep, in the background a seated girl playing the triangle; the round rock base with gilt edging and gilt border Markings: underglaze blue crossed swords 1st half 19th cent., model no. G 13, painter no. 41 (Ru) Condition: minor restorations

Materials: porcelain, polychromed and gilt Measurements: 6.89 in. (17.50 cm.) (height) Description: at the centre a boy conductor with scroll and sheet music, the facing side with a seated girl playing the mandolin, a standing boy playing the tambourine, in the foreground a dog, in the background a seated girl with harp and sheet music, the boy playing the transverse flute; the round rock base with gilt edging and gilt border Markings: underglaze blue crossed swords 1st half 19th cent., model V 24, former no. 31, 121, red painter no. 3, (Ru) Condition: minor restorations

column16: The broken Eggs (1); The broken Bridge (2)
column41: Materials: porcelain Measurements: 9.65 in. (24.50 cm.) (height) Size Notes: (1); 22.5 cm (2) Description: two works in the lot; an adoring young lady wearing garlands of flowers gazing at Cupid who is hiding under her skirt, next to them the seated mother, pointing at the turned over egg cup, in the foreground a kneeling putto with a broken egg; the adoring cavalier lifting the young lady across the broken bridge, both wound with garland of flowers, the facing side with a putto scattering roses, a putto in the back pushing the lady, the putto with quiver of arrows; the oval rock base encrusted with grass, gilt edging, gilt borders and gilt rosettes Markings: underglaze blue crossed swords with star, Marcolini Period ca. 1800, prime and 2nd quality, model no. F 63, F 65 Condition: minor restorations

Materials: porcelain, polychromed and gilt Measurements: 8.86 in. (22.50 cm.) (height) Description: seated on a Baroque stool, her little son on the armrest, her little daughter on her lap, the older son on a stool tossing playing cards at his sister; the oval base with gilt edging and gilt border Markings: blue crossed swords on the unglazed base, 1st half 19th cent., model no. E 69, former no. 28, 70, red painter no. 15 (Ru) Condition: minor restorations

Materials: porcelain, polychromed and gilt Measurements: 10.43 in. (26.50 cm.) (height) Description: seated on a Baroque stool, holding a naked child in the left arm trying to discipline it, the older sister holding her back; the oval base with gilt edging and gilt rosettes Markings: underglaze blue crossed swords 1st half 19th cent., model J 66, gilt painter no. 69 (Ru) Condition: small restoration

Materials: porcelain Measurements: 5.71 in. (14.50 cm.) (height) Description: seated on a Baroque stool, the elegant cavalier kissing her hand and peering at the money chest, next to them a faun with a ledger looking at them through a telescope, the quiver and gilt bow hanging next to them, the white base delicately heightened with gilt Markings: underglaze blue crossed swords ca. 1830, model no. 46, incised no. 44 (Ru) Condition: minor restorations

Materials: porcelain, polychromed and gilt Measurements: 12.99 in. (33.00 cm.) (height) Description: at the centre a couple in love, next to them the rejected woman in tears; the oval base encrusted with flowers, with gilt edging and gilt and purple border Markings: blue crossed swords 1st half 19th cent., model no. I 49, painter no. 42, (Ru) Condition: minor restorations

column16: A figure of a cavalier at a writing desk
column41: Materials: porcelain Measurements: 5.51 in. (14.00 cm.) (height) Description: in Baroque costume, writing a letter 'Mademoiselle votre beaute adorable me fait un devoir...', next to him a pocket watch, box, seal, pen etc., the base encrusted with polychrome flowers Markings: underglaze blue crossed swords 2nd half 19th cent., model no. 179, former no. 91, red painter no. 26

Materials: porcelain, polychromed and gilt Measurements: 16.14 in. (41.00 cm.) (height) by 14.17 in. (36.00 cm.) (width) Description: tailor and he-goat with pince-nez on their noses, the tailor with a rapier beneath his cloak, the goat with flat-iron and scissors attached to its horns Markings: underglaze blue crowned D-mark, 20th cent.

Materials: porcelain, polychromed Measurements: 12.60 in. (32.00 cm.) (height) Description: a boy pulling on the net, 2 semi-nude ladies holding the net with a Triton child, containing fish, shells, and coral, the oval rock base with shells, leaves, water course, frog, crayfish, and reeds Markings: underglaze blue crossed swords 1st half. 19th cent., model no. C 35, former no. 101 (Ru) Condition: minor restorations

column16: Pallas Athene with three small geniuses
column41: Materials: porcelain, polychromed and gilt Measurements: 8.46 in. (21.50 cm.) D, former no. 31, 121, red painter no. 3 (Ru) Condition: minor restorations

Materials: porcelain, polychromed and gilt Measurements: 5.91 in. (15.00 cm.) (height) Description: with rocking head, tongue and hands Markings: blue crossed swords on the unglazed base, 1924-1934, model no. 153

column16: A figure of Leda of the acommedia dellaartea,,
